books.title: The Great Gatsby
books.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
books.description: A classic novel exploring the decadence and moral decay of the American Dream in the 1920s.

books.title: To Kill a Mockingbird
books.author: Harper Lee
books.description: A novel depicting racial injustice in the American South during the 1930s.

books.author: George Orwell
books.description: A dystopian novel about a totalitarian regime and the dangers of mass surveillance.

books.title: The Hobbit
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: A fantasy novel about a hobbit's adventure to reclaim treasure from a dragon.

books.title: Pride and Prejudice
books.author: Jane Austen
books.description: A romantic novel featuring the lively Elizabeth Bennet and the enigmatic Mr. Darcy.

books.title: The Catcher in the Rye
books.author: J.D. Salinger
books.description: A novel about the experiences of a young man named Holden Caulfield in New York City.

books.title: Brave New World
books.author: Aldous Huxley
books.description: A dystopian novel set in a futuristic world where individuality is suppressed.

books.title: The Lord of the Rings
books.author: J.R.R. Tolkien
books.description: A high-fantasy epic that follows the journey to destroy the One Ring.

books.title: Moby-Dick
books.author: Herman Melville
books.description: A novel about Captain Ahab's obsessive quest to hunt down the white whale, Moby-Dick.

books.title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
books.author: J.K. Rowling
books.description: The first book in the Harry Potter series, which follows the young wizard's adventures at Hogwarts.
